title: 'I sneaked into business class on an eight-hour BA flight – and got away with it'
text:
Let me just start off by stressing that, generally speaking, I'm not a bad person. I am however just unhinged enough to have attempted - and succeeded - in pulling off a feat many might have daydreamed about but few have dared: sneaking from economy to business class during a flight.

It was during the second leg of a 22-hour British Airways ordeal from the UK to Australia. As a genuine sufferer of claustrophobia, I've always been a pretty bad flier, reliant on Valium to get me through, and I’d had the pleasure during the first 12-hour leg of being wedged next to an elderly couple with scant regard for personal space.

The woman spent much of this flight from London to Singapore snoring in the direction of my shoulder while her flatutant husband distributed a steady, pungent aroma across our row for the duration of the journey. Add to that my growing intolerance to sleeping pills and I barely caught a wink.
